   19: %%
   20: -module(erl_lint_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %%-define(debug, true).
   23: 
   24: -ifdef(debug).
   25: -define(line, put(line, ?LINE), ).
   26: -define(config(X,Y), foo).
   27: -define(datadir, "erl_lint_SUITE_data").
   28: -define(privdir, "erl_lint_SUITE_priv").
   29: -define(t, test_server).
   30: -else.
   31: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   32: -define(datadir, proplists:get_value(data_dir, Conf)).
   33: -define(privdir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Conf)).
   34: -endif.
   35: 
   36: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0]).
   37: 
   38: -export([singleton_type_var_errors/1,
   39:          documentation_attributes/1,
   40:          unused_vars_warn_basic/1,
   41:          unused_vars_warn_lc/1,
   42:          unused_vars_warn_rec/1,
   43:          unused_vars_warn_fun/1,
   44:          unused_vars_OTP_4858/1,
   45:          unused_unsafe_vars_warn/1,
   46:          export_vars_warn/1,
   47:          shadow_vars/1,
   48:          unused_import/1,
   49:          unused_function/1,
   50:          unsafe_vars/1,unsafe_vars2/1,
   51:          unsafe_vars_try/1,
   52:          unsized_binary_in_bin_gen_pattern/1,
   53:          guard/1, otp_4886/1, otp_4988/1, otp_5091/1, otp_5276/1, otp_5338/1,
   54:          otp_5362/1, otp_5371/1, otp_7227/1, binary_aliases/1,
   55:          otp_5494/1, otp_5644/1, otp_5878/1,
   56:          otp_5917/1, otp_6585/1, otp_6885/1, otp_10436/1, otp_11254/1,
   57:          otp_11772/1, otp_11771/1, otp_11872/1,
   58:          export_all/1,
   59:          bif_clash/1,
   60:          behaviour_basic/1, behaviour_multiple/1, otp_11861/1,
   61:          otp_7550/1,
   62:          otp_8051/1,
   63:          format_warn/1,
   64:          on_load_successful/1, on_load_failing/1,
   65:          too_many_arguments/1,
   66:          basic_errors/1,bin_syntax_errors/1,
   67:          predef/1,
   68:          maps/1,maps_type/1,maps_parallel_match/1,
   69:          otp_11851/1,otp_11879/1,otp_13230/1,
   70:          record_errors/1, otp_11879_cont/1,
   71:          non_latin1_module/1, illegal_module_name/1, otp_14323/1,
   72:          stacktrace_syntax/1,
   73:          otp_14285/1, otp_14378/1,
   74:          external_funs/1,otp_15456/1,otp_15563/1,
   75:          unused_type/1,binary_types/1,removed/1, otp_16516/1,
   76:          inline_nifs/1,
   77:          undefined_nifs/1,
   78:          no_load_nif/1,
   79:          warn_missing_spec/1,
   80:          otp_16824/1,
   81:          underscore_match/1,
   82:          unused_record/1,
   83:          unused_type2/1,
   84:          eep49/1,
   85:          redefined_builtin_type/1,
   86:          tilde_k/1,
   87:          match_float_zero/1,
   88:          undefined_module/1,
   89:          update_literal/1]).
   90: 
   91: suite() ->
   92:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   93:      {timetrap,{minutes,1}}].
   94: 
   95: all() -> 
   96:     [{group, unused_vars_warn}, export_vars_warn,
   97:      shadow_vars, unused_import, unused_function,
   98:      unsafe_vars, unsafe_vars2, unsafe_vars_try, guard,
   99:      unsized_binary_in_bin_gen_pattern,
  100:      otp_4886, otp_4988, otp_5091, otp_5276, otp_5338,
  101:      otp_5362, otp_5371, otp_7227, binary_aliases, otp_5494, otp_5644,
  102:      otp_5878, otp_5917, otp_6585, otp_6885, otp_10436, otp_11254,
  103:      otp_11772, otp_11771, otp_11872, export_all,
  104:      bif_clash, behaviour_basic, behaviour_multiple, otp_11861,
  105:      otp_7550, otp_8051, format_warn, {group, on_load},
  106:      too_many_arguments, basic_errors, bin_syntax_errors, predef,
  107:      maps, maps_type, maps_parallel_match,
  108:      otp_11851, otp_11879, otp_13230,
  109:      record_errors, otp_11879_cont,
  110:      non_latin1_module, illegal_module_name, otp_14323,
  111:      stacktrace_syntax, otp_14285, otp_14378, external_funs,
  112:      otp_15456, otp_15563, unused_type, binary_types, removed, otp_16516,
  113:      undefined_nifs,
  114:      no_load_nif,
  115:      inline_nifs, warn_missing_spec, otp_16824,
  116:      underscore_match, unused_record, unused_type2,
  117:      eep49,
  118:      redefined_builtin_type,
  119:      tilde_k,
  120:      singleton_type_var_errors,
  121:      documentation_attributes,
  122:      match_float_zero,
  123:      undefined_module,
  124:      update_literal].
  125: 
  126: groups() -> 
  127:     [{unused_vars_warn, [],
  128:       [unused_vars_warn_basic, unused_vars_warn_lc,
  129:        unused_vars_warn_rec, unused_vars_warn_fun,
  130:        unused_vars_OTP_4858, unused_unsafe_vars_warn]},
  131:      {on_load, [], [on_load_successful, on_load_failing]}].
  132: 
  133: 
  134: %% Warnings for unused variables in some simple cases.
  135: unused_vars_warn_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  136:     Ts = [{basic1,
  137:            <<"f(F) -> % F unused.
  138:                 ok.
  139: 
  140: f(F, F) ->
  141:     ok.
  142: 
  143: g(_X) ->
  144:     y.
  145: 
  146: h(P) ->
  147:     P.
  148: 
  149: x(N) ->
  150:     case a:b() of
  151: 	[N|Y] -> % Y unused.
  152: 	    ok
  153:     end.
  154: 
  155: y(N, L) ->
  156:     lists:map(fun(T) -> T*N end, L).
  157: 
  158: z(N, L) -> % N unused
  159:     lists:map(fun(N, T) -> T*N end, L).  % N shadowed.
  160: 
  161: 
  162: c(A) ->
  163:     case A of
  164: 	1 -> B = []; % B unused.
  165: 	2 -> B = []; % B unused.
  166: 	3 -> B = f, B
  167:     end.
  168: ">>,
  169: 	   [warn_unused_vars],
  170: {warnings,[{{1,23},erl_lint,{unused_var,'F'}},
  171: 	   {{15,5},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  172: 	   {{22,3},erl_lint,{unused_var,'N'}},
  173: 	   {{23,19},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'N','fun'}},
  174: 	   {{28,7},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  175: 	   {{29,7},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}}]}},
  176:           {basic2,
  177:            <<"-record(r, {x,y}).
  178:               f({X,Y}) -> {Z=X,Z=Y};
  179:               f([H|T]) -> [Z=H|Z=T];
  180:               f(#r{x=X,y=Y}) -> #r{x=A=X,y=A=Y}.
  181:               g({M, F}) -> (Z=M):(Z=F)();
  182:               g({M, F, Arg}) -> (Z=M):F(Z=Arg).
  183:               h(X, Y) -> (Z=X) + (Z=Y).">>,
  184:            [warn_unused_vars], []},
  185:           {basic3,
  186:            <<"f(E) ->
  187:                   X = Y = E.">>,
  188:            [warn_unused_vars],
  189:            {warnings,[{{2,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  190:                       {{2,23},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}}]}}],
  191:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  192:     ok.
  193: 
  194: %% Warnings for unused variables in list comprehensions.
  195: unused_vars_warn_lc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  196:     Ts = [{lc1, 
  197:            <<"bin([X]) ->
  198:                   [A || <<A:X>> <- []]; % X used, not shadowed.
  199:               bin({X}) ->
  200:                   [X || <<X:X>> <- []]; % X used, and shadowed.
  201:               bin({X,Y,Z}) ->
  202:                   [{A,B} || <<A:X>> <- Z, <<B:Y>> <- Z];
  203:               bin([X,Y,Z]) -> % Y unused.
  204:                   [C || <<V:X>> <- Z, <<B:V>> <- Z, <<C:B>> <- Z].
  205:            ">>, 
  206:            [warn_unused_vars],
  207:            {warnings, [{{4,27},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  208:                        {{7,22},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}}]}},
  209: 
  210:           {lc2,
  211:            <<"bin([X]) ->
  212:                   [A || <<A:X>> <- []]; % X used, not shadowed.
  213:               bin({X}) ->
  214:                   [X || <<X:X>> <- []]; % X used, and shadowed.
  215:               bin({X,Y,Z}) ->
  216:                   [{A,B} || <<A:X>> <- Z, <<B:Y>> <- Z];
  217:               bin([X,Y,Z]) -> % Y unused.
  218:                   [C || <<V:X>> <- Z, <<B:V>> <- Z, <<C:B>> <- Z].
  219:            ">>,
  220:            [warn_unused_vars],
  221:            {warnings,[{{4,27},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  222:                       {{7,22},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}}]}},
  223: 
  224:           {lc3,
  225:            <<"a([A]) ->
  226:                   B = foo,
  227:                   [{C,B} || {C,_} <- A];
  228:               a({A}) ->
  229:                   B = foo,
  230:                   [C || {C,_} <- [B,A]];
  231:               a({A,A}) ->
  232:                   B = foo,
  233:                   [C || {C,_} <- B, B < A].
  234:            ">>,
  235:            [warn_unused_vars],
  236:            []},
  237: 
  238:           {lc4,
  239:            <<"b(A) ->
  240:                   B = foo, % B unused.
  241:                   [C || {C,_} <- A].
  242:            ">>,
  243:            [warn_unused_vars],
  244:            {warnings,[{{2,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}}]}},
  245: 
  246:           {lc5,
  247:            <<"c(A) ->
  248:                   B = foo,
  249:                   [C || {C,_} <- A],
  250:                   B.
  251:            ">>,
  252:            [warn_unused_vars],
  253:            []},
  254: 
  255:           {lc6,
  256:            <<"d(A) ->
  257:                   B = foo,
  258:                   [{A,B} || {Id,_} <- A]. % Id unused.
  259:            ">>,
  260:            [warn_unused_vars],
  261:            {warnings,[{{3,30},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Id'}}]}},
  262: 
  263:           {lc7,
  264:            <<"e(A) ->
  265:                   B = foo, % B unused.
  266:                   [B || B <- A]. % B shadowed.
  267:            ">>,
  268:            [warn_unused_vars],
  269:            {warnings,[{{2,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  270:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'B',generate}}]}},
  271: 
  272:           {lc8,
  273:            <<"f(A) ->
  274:                   B = foo,
  275:                   [B || B <- A], % B shadowed.
  276:                   B.
  277:            ">>,
  278:            [warn_unused_vars],
  279:            {warnings,[{{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'B',generate}}]}},
  280: 
  281:           {lc9,
  282:            <<"g(A) ->
  283:                   B = foo, % B unused.
  284:                   [A || B <- A]. % B shadowed, B unused.
  285:            ">>,
  286:            [warn_unused_vars],
  287:            {warnings,[{{2,19},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  288:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  289:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'B',generate}}]}},
  290: 
  291:           {lc10,
  292:            <<"h(A) ->
  293:                   B = foo,
  294:                   [A || B <- A], % B shadowed, B unused.
  295:                   B.
  296:            ">>,
  297:            [warn_unused_vars],
  298:            {warnings,[{{3,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'B'}},
  299:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'B',generate}}]}},
  300: 
  301:           {lc11,
  302:            <<"i(X) ->
  303:                   [Z || Z <- X, % Z unused.
  304:                         Z = X <- [foo]]. % X and Z shadowed. X unused!
  305:            ">>,
  306:            [warn_unused_vars],
  307:            {warnings,[{{2,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  308:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}},
  309:                       {{3,29},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  310:                       {{3,29},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}}]}},
  311: 
  312:           {lc12,
  313:            <<"j({X}) ->
  314:                   [Z || Z <- X, % Z unused.
  315:                         Z <- X = [[1,2,3]], % Z shadowed. Z unused.
  316:                         Z <- X, % Z shadowed. Z unused.
  317:                         Z <- X]; % Z shadowed.
  318:               j(X) ->
  319:                   [foo || X <- X, % X shadowed.
  320:                         X <-    % X shadowed. X unused.
  321:                              X =
  322:                                  Y = [[1,2,3]], % Y unused.
  323:                         X <- [], % X shadowed.
  324:                         X <- X]. % X shadowed. X unused.
  325:            ">>,
  326:            [warn_unused_vars],
  327:            {warnings,[{{2,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  328:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  329:                       {{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}},
  330:                       {{4,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  331:                       {{4,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}},
  332:                       {{5,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}},
  333:                       {{7,27},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  334:                       {{8,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  335:                       {{8,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  336:                       {{10,34},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  337:                       {{11,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}},
  338:                       {{12,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  339:                       {{12,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'X',generate}}]}},
  340: 
  341:           {lc13,
  342:            <<"k(X) ->
  343:                   [Z || Z <- Y = X]; % Y unused.
  344:               k(X) ->
  345:                   [Z || Z <- X = Y = X]; % Y unused!
  346:               k(X) ->
  347:                   [Z || Z <- begin X = Y = X, Y end];
  348:               k(X) ->
  349:                   [{Y,W} || W <- Y = X]; % Y unbound
  350:               k(X) ->
  351:                   [Z || Z <- (Y = X), % Y unused.
  352:                        Y > X]; % Y unbound.
  353:               k(X) ->
  354:                   [Y || Y = X > 3, Z = X]; % Z unused.
  355:               k(X) ->
  356:                   [Z || Y = X > 3, Z = X]. % Y unused.
  357:            ">>,
  358:            [warn_unused_vars],
  359:            {error,[{{8,21},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'Y'}},
  360:                    {{11,24},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'Y'}}],
  361:                   [{{2,30},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  362:                    {{4,34},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  363:                    {{8,34},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  364:                    {{10,31},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  365:                    {{13,36},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  366:                    {{15,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}}]}},
  367: 
  368:           {lc14,
  369:            <<"lc2() ->
  370:                   Z = [[1],[2],[3]], 
  371:                   [X || Z <- Z, % Z shadowed.
  372:                         X <- Z].
  373:            ">>,
  374:            [warn_unused_vars],
  375:            {warnings,[{{3,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}}]}},
  376: 
  377:           {lc15,
  378:            <<"lc3() ->
  379:                   Z = [1,2,3], 
  380:                   [X || X <- Z, 
  381:                         Z <- Z]. % Z shadowed. Z unused.
  382:            ">>,
  383:            [warn_unused_vars],
  384:            {warnings,[{{4,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Z'}},
  385:                       {{4,25},erl_lint,{shadowed_var,'Z',generate}}]}},
  386: 
  387:           {lc16,
  388:            <<"bin(Z) ->
  389:                   case bar of
  390:                       true ->
  391:                           U = 2;
  392:                       false ->
  393:                           true
  394:                   end,
  395:                   case bar of
  396:                       true ->
  397:                           X = 2;
  398:                       false ->
  399:                           X = 3
  400:                   end,
  401:                   case foo of
  402:                       true ->
  403:                           Y = 3; % Y unused.
  404:                       false ->
  405:                           4
  406:                   end,
  407:                   case foo of
  408:                       1 ->
  409:                           U; % U unsafe.
  410:                       2 ->
  411:                           [Z || <<U:X>> <- Z]; % (X exported.) U unused.
  412:                       3 ->
  413:                           [Z || <<U:X>> <- Z], % (X exported.) U unused.
  414:                           U % U unsafe.
  415:                   end.
  416:            ">>,
  417:            [warn_unused_vars],
  418:            {error,[{{22,27},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'U',{'case',{2,19}}}},
  419:                    {{27,27},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'U',{'case',{2,19}}}}],
  420:             [{{16,27},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  421:              {{24,35},erl_lint,{unused_var,'U'}},
  422:              {{26,35},erl_lint,{unused_var,'U'}}]}},
  423: 
  424:           {lc17,
  425:            <<"bin(Z) ->
  426:                   %% This used to pass erl_lint...
  427:                   case bar of
  428:                       true ->
  429:                           U = 2;
  430:                       false ->
  431:                           true
  432:                   end,
  433:                   case bar of
  434:                       true ->
  435:                           X = 2;
  436:                       false ->
  437:                           X = 3
  438:                   end,
  439:                   case foo of
  440:                       true ->
  441:                           Y = 3; % Y unused.
  442:                       false ->
  443:                           4
  444:                   end,
  445:                   [Z || <<U:X>> <- Z], % (X exported.) U unused.
  446:                   U. % U unsafe.
  447:            ">>,
  448:            [warn_unused_vars],
  449:            {error,[{{22,19},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'U',{'case',{3,19}}}}],
  450:             [{{17,27},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Y'}},
  451:              {{21,27},erl_lint,{unused_var,'U'}}]}},
  452: 
  453:           {lc18,
  454:            <<"bin(Z) ->
  455:                   case bar of
  456:                       true ->
  457:                           U = 2;
  458:                       false ->
  459:                           true
  460:                   end,
  461:                   case bar of
  462:                       true ->
  463:                           X = 2;
  464:                       false ->
  465:                           X = 3
  466:                   end,
  467:                   case foo of
  468:                       true ->
  469:                           Y = 3;
  470:                       false ->
  471:                           4
  472:                   end,
  473:                   [B || <<U: % U unused
  474:                           U>> <- X, <<B:Y>> <- Z]. % U unsafe. Y unsafe. 
  475: 						% U shadowed. (X exported.)
  476:            ">>,
  477:            [warn_unused_vars],
  478:            {error,[{{21,27},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'U',{'case',{2,19}}}},
  479:                    {{21,41},erl_lint,{unsafe_var,'Y',{'case',{14,19}}}}],
  480:             [{{20,27},erl_lint,{unused_var,'U'}}
  481:             ]}},
  482: 
  483:           {lc19,
  484:            <<"p({B,C}) ->
  485:                   <<A:B,A:C>> = <<17:32>>;
  486:               p(B) ->
  487:                   <<A:B>> = <<17:32>>. % A unused.
  488:            ">>,
  489:            [warn_unused_vars],
  490:            {warnings,[{{4,21},erl_lint,{unused_var,'A'}}]}},
  491: 
  492:           {lc20,
  493:            <<"c({I1,I2}) ->
  494:                   if
  495:                       <<I1:I2>> == <<>> ->
  496:                           foo
  497:                   end;
  498:               c([C1,C2]) -> % C1 unused.
  499:                   case foo of
  500:                       <<C2:C2,
  501:                         C3:C2>> -> % C3 unused.
  502:                           bar
  503:                   end.
  504: 
  505:            ">>,
  506:            [warn_unused_vars],
  507:            {warnings,[{{6,18},erl_lint,{unused_var,'C1'}},
  508:                       {{7,19},sys_core_fold,{nomatch,no_clause}},
  509:                       {{9,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'C3'}}]}},
  510: 
  511:           {lc21,
  512:            <<"t() ->
  513:                   S = 8,
  514:                   case <<3:8>> of
  515:                       <<X:S>> ->
  516:                           X;
  517:                       <<S:X>> -> % X unbound
  518:                           foo
  519:                   end;
  520:               t() ->
  521:                   S = 8,
  522:                   case <<3:8>> of
  523:                       <<S:S>> ->
  524:                           S;
  525:                       <<Q:32>> -> % Q unused.
  526:                           foo
  527:                   end.
  528:            ">>,
  529:            [warn_unused_vars],
  530:            {error,[{{6,27},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'X'}}],
  531:                   [{{14,25},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Q'}}]}}
  532: 
  533:           ],
  534:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  535:     ok.
  536: 
  537: 
  538: %% Warnings for unused variables in records.
  539: unused_vars_warn_rec(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  540:     Ts = [{rec1, % An example provided by Bjorn.
  541:            <<"-record(edge,
  542:                       {ltpr,
  543:                        ltsu,
  544:                        rtpr,
  545:                        rtsu
  546:                       }).
  547: 
  548:               f1(#edge{ltpr = A, ltsu = A}) ->
  549:                   true;
  550:               f1({Q, Q}) ->
  551:                   true.
  552: 
  553:               f2(Edge, Etab) ->
  554:                   case gb_trees:lookup(Edge, Etab) of
  555:                       {value,#edge{ltpr=Same,ltsu=Same}} -> ok;
  556:                       {value,_} -> error
  557:                   end.
  558: 
  559:               bar(Edge, Etab) ->
  560:                   case gb_trees:lookup(Edge, Etab) of
  561:                       {Same,Same} -> ok;
  562:                       {value,#edge{ltpr=Same}} -> ok; % Same unused.
  563:                       {value,_} -> error
  564:                   end.
  565:            ">>,
  566:            [warn_unused_vars],
  567:            {warnings,[{{22,41},erl_lint,{unused_var,'Same'}}]}},
  568:           {rec2,
  569:            <<"-record(r, {a,b}).
  570:               f(X, Y) -> #r{a=[K || K <- Y], b=[K || K <- Y]}.
  571:               g(X, Y) -> #r{a=lists:map(fun (K) -> K end, Y),
  572:                             b=lists:map(fun (K) -> K end, Y)}.
  573:               h(X, Y) -> #r{a=case Y of _ when is_list(Y) -> Y end,
  574:                             b=case Y of _ when is_list(Y) -> Y end}.
  575:               i(X, Y) -> #r{a=if is_list(Y) -> Y end, b=if is_list(Y) -> Y end}.
  576:              ">>,
  577:            [warn_unused_vars],
  578:            {warnings,[{{2,17},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  579:                       {{3,17},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  580:                       {{5,17},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}},
  581:                       {{7,17},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}}]}},
  582:           {rec3,
  583:            <<"-record(r, {a}).
  584:               t() -> X = 1, #r{a=foo, a=bar, a=qux}.
  585:              ">>,
  586:            [warn_unused_vars],
  587:            {error,[{{2,39},erl_lint,{redefine_field,r,a}},
  588:                    {{2,46},erl_lint,{redefine_field,r,a}}],
  589:                   [{{2,22},erl_lint,{unused_var,'X'}}]}}],
  590:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  591:     ok.

  593: %% Warnings for unused variables in funs.

  782: %% Warnings for exported variables.
  783: export_vars_warn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  784:     Ts = [{exp1,
  785:            <<"u() ->
  786:                   case foo of
  787:                       1 ->
  788:                           A = 1,

  793:                           B = 2,
  794:                           Z = 4 % Z unused.
  795:                   end,
  796:                   case bar of

  798:                           A = 17, % A unsafe.

  800:                           U = 2,
  801:                           U;
  802:                       false ->
  803:                           B = 19, % B exported.
  804:                           U = 3; % U unused.
  805:                       foo ->
  806:                           X = 3,
  807:                           X;
  808:                       bar ->
  809:                           X = 9, % X unused.

  811:                   end.
  812:            ">>,
  813:            [warn_unused_vars],

  875: %% Shadowed variables are tested in other places, but here we test
  876: %% that the warning can be turned off.
  877: shadow_vars(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  878:     Ts = [{shadow1,
  879: 	   <<"bin(A) ->
  880:                   receive
  881:                       M ->
  882:                            X = M,
  883:                            Y = M,
  884:                            Z = M
  885:                   end,
  886:                   [B || <<B:X>> <- A],
  887:                   Y = B,
  888:                   [B || B <- Z]. % B shadowed.
  889:            ">>,
  890: 	   [nowarn_shadow_vars],
  891: 	   {error,[{{9,23},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'B'}}],
  892: 	    [{{9,19},erl_lint,{exported_var,'Y',{'receive',{2,19}}}}]}},
  893:           {shadow2,
  894:            <<"t() ->
  895:                   _ = (catch MS = MS = 1), % MS used unsafe
  896:                   _ = case ok of _ -> fun() -> ok end end,
  897:                   fun (MS) -> MS end. % MS not shadowed here
  898:            ">>,
  899:            [],
  900:            []}],
  901:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
  902:     ok.

 1605: %% OTP-4670. Guards, is_record in particular.
 1606: guard(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1607:     %% Well, these could be plain code...
 1608:     Ts = [{guard1,
 1609:            <<"-record(apa, {}).
 1610:               t(A) when atom(A) ->
 1611:                   atom;
 1612:               t(A) when binary(A) ->
 1613:                   binary;
 1614:               t(A) when constant(A) ->
 1615:                   constant;
 1616:               t(A) when float(A) ->
 1617:                   float;
 1618:               t(A) when function(A) ->
 1619:                   function;
 1620:               t(A) when integer(A) ->
 1621:                   integer;
 1622:               t(A) when is_atom(A) ->
 1623:                   is_atom;
 1624:               t(A) when is_binary(A) ->
 1625:                   is_binary;
 1626:               t(A) when is_constant(A) ->
 1627:                   is_constant;

 2487: %% OTP-15456. All compiler options can now be given in the option list
 2488: %% (as opposed to only in files).
 2489: otp_15456(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2490:     Ts = [
 2491:           %% {nowarn_deprecated_function,[{M,F,A}]} can now be given
 2492:           %% in the option list as well as in an attribute.
 2493:           %% Wherever it occurs, it is not affected by
 2494:           %% warn_deprecated_function.
 2495:           {otp_15456_1,
 2496:            <<"-compile({nowarn_deprecated_function,{erlang,now,0}}).
 2497:               -export([foo/0]).
 2498: 
 2499:               foo() ->
 2500:                   {erlang:now(), random:seed0(), random:seed(1, 2, 3),
 2501:                    random:uniform(), random:uniform(42)}.
 2502:            ">>,
 2503:            {[{nowarn_deprecated_function,{random,seed0,0}},
 2504:              {nowarn_deprecated_function,[{random,uniform,0},
 2505:                                           {random,uniform,1}]},
 2506:              %% There should be no warnings when attempting to
 2507:              %% turn of warnings for functions that are not
 2508:              %% deprecated or not used in the module.
 2509:              {nowarn_deprecated_function,{random,uniform_s,1}},
 2510:              {nowarn_deprecated_function,{erlang,abs,1}},
 2511:              warn_deprecated_function]},
 2512:            {warnings,[{{5,50},erl_lint,
 2513:                        {deprecated,{random,seed,3},
 2514:                         "use the 'rand' module instead"}}]}},
 2515: 
 2516:           %% {nowarn_unused_function,[{M,F,A}]} can be given
 2517:           %% in the option list as well as in an attribute.
 2518:           %% It was incorrectly documented to only work when
 2519:           %% given in an attribute.
 2520:           {otp_15456_2,
 2521:            <<"-compile({nowarn_unused_function,foo/0}).
 2522:               foo() -> ok.
 2523:               bar() -> ok.
 2524:               foobar() -> ok.
 2525:               barf(_) -> ok.
 2526:               other() -> ok.
 2527:            ">>,
 2528:            {[{nowarn_unused_function,[{bar,0},{foobar,0}]},
 2529:              {nowarn_unused_function,{barf,1}},
 2530:              %% There should be no warnings when attempting to
 2531:              %% turn of warnings for unused functions that are not
 2532:              %% defined in the module.
 2533:              {nowarn_unused_function,{not_defined_in_module,1}},
 2534:              warn_unused_function]},
 2535:            {warnings,[{{6,15},erl_lint,{unused_function,{other,0}}}]}
 2536:           }],
 2537: 
 2538:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 2539:     ok.

 3167: %% Test warnings for functions that clash with BIFs.
 3168: bif_clash(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3169:     Ts = [{clash1,
 3170:            <<"t(X) ->
 3171:                   size(X).
 3172: 
 3173:               %% No warning for the following calls, since they
 3174:               %% are unambigous.
 3175:               b(X) ->
 3176:                   erlang:size(X).
 3177:

 3179:                   ?MODULE:size(X).
 3180:

 3182:                 N.

 3184:            [],
 3185: 	   {errors,[{{2,19},erl_lint,{call_to_redefined_old_bif,{size,1}}}],[]}},
 3186: 
 3187: 	  %% Verify that warnings cannot be turned off in the old way.
 3188: 	  {clash2,
 3189:            <<"-export([t/1,size/1]).
 3190:               t(X) ->
 3191:                   size(X).
 3192: 
 3193:               size({N,_}) ->
 3194:                 N.
 3195: 
 3196:               %% My own abs/1 function works on lists too. From R14 this really works.
 3197:               abs([H|T]) when $a =< H, H =< $z -> [H-($a-$A)|abs(T)];
 3198:               abs([H|T]) -> [H|abs(T)];
 3199:               abs([]) -> [];
 3200:               abs(X) -> erlang:abs(X).
 3201:              ">>,
 3202: 	   {[nowarn_unused_function,nowarn_bif_clash]},
 3203: 	   {errors,[{erl_lint,disallowed_nowarn_bif_clash}],[]}},
 3204: 	  %% As long as noone calls an overridden BIF, it's totally OK
 3205: 	  {clash3,
 3206:            <<"-export([size/1]).
 3207:               size({N,_}) ->
 3208:                 N;
 3209:               size(X) ->
 3210:                 erlang:size(X).
 3211:              ">>,
 3212: 	   [],
 3213: 	   []},
 3214: 	  %% But this is totally wrong - meaning of the program changed in R14, so this is an error
 3215: 	  {clash4,
 3216:            <<"-export([size/1]).
 3217:               size({N,_}) ->
 3218:                 N;
 3219:               size(X) ->
 3220:                 size(X).
 3221:              ">>,
 3222: 	   [],
 3223: 	   {errors,[{{5,17},erl_lint,{call_to_redefined_old_bif,{size,1}}}],[]}},
 3224: 	  %% For a post R14 bif, its only a warning
 3225: 	  {clash5,
 3226:            <<"-export([binary_part/2]).
 3227:               binary_part({B,_},{X,Y}) ->
 3228:                 binary_part(B,{X,Y});
 3229:               binary_part(B,{X,Y}) ->
 3230:                 binary:part(B,X,Y).
 3231:              ">>,
 3232: 	   [],
 3233: 	   {warnings,[{{3,17},erl_lint,{call_to_redefined_bif,{binary_part,2}}}]}},
 3234: 	  %% If you really mean to call yourself here, you can "unimport" size/1
 3235: 	  {clash6,
 3236:            <<"-export([size/1]).
 3237:               -compile({no_auto_import,[size/1]}).
 3238:               size([]) ->
 3239:                 0;
 3240:               size({N,_}) ->
 3241:                 N;
 3242:               size([_|T]) ->
 3243:                 1+size(T).
 3244:              ">>,
 3245: 	   [],
 3246: 	   []},
 3247: 	  %% Same for the post R14 autoimport warning
 3248: 	  {clash7,
 3249:            <<"-export([binary_part/2]).
 3250:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3251:               binary_part({B,_},{X,Y}) ->
 3252:                 binary_part(B,{X,Y});
 3253:               binary_part(B,{X,Y}) ->
 3254:                 binary:part(B,X,Y).
 3255:              ">>,
 3256: 	   [],
 3257: 	   []},
 3258:           %% but this doesn't mean the local function is allowed in a guard...
 3259: 	  {clash8,
 3260:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3261:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3262:               x(X) when binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= <<1,2>> ->
 3263:                  hej.
 3264:               binary_part({B,_},{X,Y}) ->
 3265:                 binary_part(B,{X,Y});
 3266:               binary_part(B,{X,Y}) ->
 3267:                 binary:part(B,X,Y).
 3268:              ">>,
 3269: 	   [],
 3270: 	   {errors,[{{3,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{binary_part,2}}}],[]}},
 3271:           %% no_auto_import is not like nowarn_bif_clash, it actually removes the autoimport
 3272: 	  {clash9,
 3273:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3274:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3275:               x(X) ->
 3276:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= <<1,2>>.
 3277:              ">>,
 3278: 	   [],
 3279: 	   {errors,[{{4,18},erl_lint,{undefined_function,{binary_part,2}}}],[]}},
 3280:           %% but we could import it again...
 3281: 	  {clash10,
 3282:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3283:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3284:               -import(erlang,[binary_part/2]).
 3285:               x(X) ->
 3286:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= <<1,2>>.
 3287:              ">>,
 3288: 	   [],
 3289: 	   []},
 3290:           %% and actually use it in a guard...
 3291: 	  {clash11,
 3292:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3293:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3294:               -import(erlang,[binary_part/2]).
 3295:               x(X) when binary_part(X,{0,1}) =:= <<0>> ->
 3296:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= <<1,2>>.
 3297:              ">>,
 3298: 	   [],
 3299: 	   []},
 3300:           %% but for non-obvious historical reasons, imported functions cannot be used in
 3301: 	  %% fun construction without the module name...
 3302: 	  {clash12,
 3303:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3304:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3305:               -import(erlang,[binary_part/2]).
 3306:               x(X) when binary_part(X,{0,1}) =:= <<0>> ->
 3307:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= fun binary_part/2.
 3308:              ">>,
 3309: 	   [],
 3310: 	   {errors,[{{5,43},erl_lint,{undefined_function,{binary_part,2}}}],[]}},
 3311:           %% Not from erlang and not from anywhere else
 3312: 	  {clash13,
 3313:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3314:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/2]}).
 3315:               -import(x,[binary_part/2]).
 3316:               x(X) ->
 3317:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= fun binary_part/2.
 3318:              ">>,
 3319: 	   [],
 3320: 	   {errors,[{{5,43},erl_lint,{undefined_function,{binary_part,2}}}],[]}},
 3321: 	  %% ...while real auto-import is OK.
 3322: 	  {clash14,
 3323:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3324:               x(X) when binary_part(X,{0,1}) =:= <<0>> ->
 3325:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}) =:= fun binary_part/2.
 3326:              ">>,
 3327: 	   [],
 3328: 	   []},
 3329:           %% Import directive clashing with old bif is an error, regardless of if it's called or not
 3330: 	  {clash15,
 3331:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3332:               -import(x,[abs/1]).
 3333:               x(X) ->
 3334:                  binary_part(X,{1,2}).
 3335:              ">>,
 3336: 	   [],
 3337: 	   {errors,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{redefine_old_bif_import,{abs,1}}}],[]}},
 3338: 	  %% For a new BIF, it's only a warning
 3339: 	  {clash16,
 3340:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3341:               -import(x,[binary_part/3]).
 3342:               x(X) ->
 3343:                  abs(X).
 3344:              ">>,
 3345: 	   [],
 3346: 	   {warnings,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{redefine_bif_import,{binary_part,3}}}]}},
 3347: 	  %% And, you cannot redefine already imported things that aren't auto-imported
 3348: 	  {clash17,
 3349:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3350:               -import(x,[binary_port/3]).
 3351:               -import(y,[binary_port/3]).
 3352:               x(X) ->
 3353:                  abs(X).
 3354:              ">>,
 3355: 	   [],
 3356: 	   {errors,[{{3,16},erl_lint,{redefine_import,{{binary_port,3},x}}}],[]}},
 3357: 	  %% Not with local functions either
 3358: 	  {clash18,
 3359:            <<"-export([x/1]).
 3360:               -import(x,[binary_port/3]).
 3361:               binary_port(A,B,C) ->
 3362:                  binary_part(A,B,C).
 3363:               x(X) ->
 3364:                  abs(X).
 3365:              ">>,
 3366: 	   [],
 3367: 	   {errors,[{{3,15},erl_lint,{define_import,{binary_port,3}}}],[]}},
 3368: 	  %% Like clash8: Dont accept a guard if it's explicitly module-name called either
 3369: 	  {clash19,
 3370:            <<"-export([binary_port/3]).
 3371:               -compile({no_auto_import,[binary_part/3]}).
 3372:               -import(x,[binary_part/3]).
 3373:               binary_port(A,B,C) when x:binary_part(A,B,C) ->
 3374:                  binary_part(A,B,C+1).
 3375:              ">>,
 3376: 	   [],
 3377: 	   {errors,[{{4,39},erl_lint,illegal_guard_expr}],[]}},
 3378: 	  %% Not with local functions either
 3379: 	  {clash20,
 3380:            <<"-export([binary_port/3]).
 3381:               -import(x,[binary_part/3]).
 3382:               binary_port(A,B,C) ->
 3383:                  binary_part(A,B,C).
 3384:              ">>,
 3385: 	   [warn_unused_import],
 3386: 	   {warnings,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{redefine_bif_import,{binary_part,3}}}]}},
 3387: 	  %% Don't accept call to a guard BIF if there is a local definition
 3388: 	  %% or an import with the same name. Note: is_record/2 is an
 3389: 	  %% exception, since it is more of syntatic sugar than a real BIF.
 3390: 	  {clash21,
 3391:            <<"-export([is_list/1]).
 3392:               -import(x, [is_tuple/1]).
 3393:               -record(r, {a,b}).
 3394:               x(T) when is_tuple(T) -> ok;
 3395:               x(T) when is_list(T) -> ok.
 3396:               y(T) when is_tuple(T) =:= true -> ok;
 3397:               y(T) when is_list(T) =:= true -> ok;
 3398:               y(T) when is_record(T, r, 3) -> ok;
 3399:               y(T) when is_record(T, r, 3) =:= true -> ok;
 3400:               y(T) when is_record(T, r) =:= true -> ok.
 3401:               is_list(_) ->
 3402:                 ok.
 3403:               is_record(_, _) ->
 3404:                 ok.
 3405:               is_record(_, _, _) ->
 3406:                 ok.
 3407:              ">>,
 3408: 	   [{no_auto_import,[{is_tuple,1}]}],
 3409: 	   {errors,[{{4,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_tuple,1}}},
 3410: 		    {{5,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_list,1}}},
 3411: 		    {{6,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_tuple,1}}},
 3412: 		    {{7,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_list,1}}},
 3413: 		    {{8,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_record,3}}},
 3414: 		    {{9,25},erl_lint,{illegal_guard_local_call,{is_record,3}}}],[]}},
 3415: 	  %% We can also suppress all auto imports at once
 3416: 	  {clash22,
 3417:           <<"-export([size/1, binary_part/2]).
 3418:              -compile(no_auto_import).
 3419:              size([]) ->
 3420:                0;
 3421:              size({N,_}) ->
 3422:                N;
 3423:              size([_|T]) ->
 3424:                1+size(T).
 3425:              binary_part({B,_},{X,Y}) ->
 3426:                binary_part(B,{X,Y});
 3427:              binary_part(B,{X,Y}) ->
 3428:                binary:part(B,X,Y).
 3429:             ">>,
 3430: 	   [],
 3431: 	   []}
 3432: 	 ],
 3433: 
 3434:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 3435:     ok.

 3437: %% Basic tests with one behaviour.

 3440:            <<"-behaviour(application).
 3441:              ">>,
 3442:            [],
 3443: 	   {warnings,[{{1,22},erl_lint,{undefined_behaviour_func,{start,2},application}},
 3444: 		      {{1,22},erl_lint,{undefined_behaviour_func,{stop,1},application}}]}},
 3445: 
 3446: 	  {behaviour2,
 3447:            <<"-behaviour(application).
 3448:               -export([stop/1]).
 3449:               stop(_) -> ok.
 3450:              ">>,
 3451:            [],
 3452: 	   {warnings,[{{1,22},erl_lint,{undefined_behaviour_func,{start,2},application}}]}},
 3453: 	  
 3454: 	  {behaviour3,
 3455:            <<"-behavior(application).  %% Test American spelling.
 3456:               -export([start/2,stop/1]).
 3457:               start(_, _) -> ok.
 3458:               stop(_) -> ok.
 3459:              ">>,
 3460:            [],
 3461:            []},

 3466:               stop(_) -> ok.
 3467:              ">>,
 3468:            [],
 3469:            {warnings,[{{1,22},erl_lint,{undefined_behaviour_func,{start,2},application}}]}}
 3470: 	 ],
 3471:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 3472:     ok.

 3474: %% Basic tests with multiple behaviours.
 3475: behaviour_multiple(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3476:     Ts = [{behaviour1,
 3477:            <<"-behaviour(application).
 3478:               -behaviour(supervisor).
 3479:              ">>,
 3480:            [],
 3481: 	   {warnings,[{{1,22},erl_lint,{undefined_behaviour_func,{start,2},application}},
 3482: 		      {{1,22},erl_lint,{undefined_behaviour_func,{stop,1},application}},
 3483: 		      {{2,16},erl_lint,{undefined_behaviour_func,{init,1},supervisor}}]}},
 3484: 
 3485: 	  {behaviour2,
 3486:            <<"-behaviour(application).
 3487:               -behaviour(supervisor).
 3488:               -export([start/2,stop/1,init/1]).
 3489:               start(_, _) -> ok.
 3490:               stop(_) -> ok.
 3491:               init(_) -> ok.
 3492:              ">>,
 3493:            [],
 3494: 	   []},
 3495:

 3500:               start(_, _) -> ok.
 3501:               stop(_) -> ok.
 3502:               init(_) -> ok.
 3503:              ">>,
 3504:            [],
 3505: 	   []},

 3524:               -export([handle_call/3,handle_cast/2,handle_info/2]).
 3525:               handle_call(_, _, _) -> ok.
 3526:               handle_cast(_, _) -> ok.
 3527:               handle_info(_, _) -> ok.
 3528:              ">>,
 3529:            [],
 3530: 	   {warnings,[{{1,22},erl_lint,{undefined_behaviour_func,{init,1},gen_server}},
 3531: 		      {{2,16},erl_lint,{undefined_behaviour_func,{init,1},supervisor}},
 3532: 		      {{2,16},
 3533: 		       erl_lint,
 3534: 		       {conflicting_behaviours,{init,1},supervisor,{1,22},gen_server}}]}},
 3535:

 3538:               -behaviour(gen_fsm).
 3539:               -behaviour(supervisor).
 3540:               -export([init/1,handle_call/3,handle_cast/2,

 3547:               handle_event(_, _, _) -> ok.
 3548:               handle_sync_event(_, _, _, _) -> ok.
 3549:               handle_cast(_, _) -> ok.
 3550:               handle_info(_, _) -> ok.
 3551:               handle_info(_, _, _) -> ok.
 3552:               code_change(_, _, _) -> ok.
 3553:               code_change(_, _, _, _) -> ok.
 3554:               terminate(_, _) -> ok.
 3555:               terminate(_, _, _) -> ok.
 3556:               terminate(_, _, _, _) -> ok.
 3557:              ">>,
 3558:            [],
 3559: 	   {warnings,[{{2,16},
 3560: 		       erl_lint,
 3561: 		       {conflicting_behaviours,{init,1},gen_fsm,{1,22},gen_server}},
 3562: 		      {{3,16},
 3563: 		       erl_lint,
 3564: 		       {conflicting_behaviours,{init,1},supervisor,{1,22},gen_server}}]}}
 3565: 	 ],
 3566:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 3567:     ok.

 3569: %% OTP-11861. behaviour_info() and -callback.
 3570: otp_11861(Conf) when is_list(Conf) ->
 3571:     CallbackFiles = [callback1, callback2, callback3,
 3572:                      bad_behaviour1, bad_behaviour2],
 3573:     lists:foreach(fun(M) ->
 3574:                           F = filename:join(?datadir, M),
 3575:                           Opts = [{outdir,?privdir}, return],
 3576:                           {ok, M, []} = compile:file(F, Opts)
 3577:                   end, CallbackFiles),
 3578:     CodePath = code:get_path(),
 3579:     true = code:add_path(?privdir),
 3580:     Ts = [{otp_11861_1,
 3581:            <<"
 3582:               -export([b1/1]).
 3583:               -behaviour(callback1).
 3584:               -behaviour(callback2).
 3585: 
 3586:               -spec b1(atom()) -> integer().
 3587:               b1(A) when is_atom(A)->
 3588:                   3.
 3589:              ">>,
 3590:            [],
 3591:            %% b2/1 is optional in both modules
 3592:            {warnings,[{{4,16},erl_lint,
 3593:                        {conflicting_behaviours,{b1,1},callback2,{3,16},callback1}}]}},
 3594:           {otp_11861_2,
 3595:            <<"
 3596:               -export([b2/1]).
 3597:               -behaviour(callback1).
 3598:               -behaviour(callback2).
 3599: 
 3600:               -spec b2(integer()) -> atom().
 3601:               b2(I) when is_integer(I)->
 3602:                   a.
 3603:              ">>,
 3604:            [],
 3605:            %% b2/1 is optional in callback2, but not in callback1
 3606:            {warnings,[{{3,16},erl_lint,{undefined_behaviour_func,{b1,1},callback1}},
 3607:                       {{4,16},erl_lint,
 3608:                        {conflicting_behaviours,{b2,1},callback2,{3,16},callback1}}]}},
 3609:           {otp_11861_3,
 3610:            <<"
 3611:               -callback b(_) -> atom().
 3612:               -optional_callbacks({b1,1}). % non-existing and ignored
 3613:              ">>,
 3614:            [],
 3615:            []},
 3616:           {otp_11861_4,
 3617:            <<"
 3618:               -callback b(_) -> atom().
 3619:               -optional_callbacks([{b1,1}]). % non-existing
 3620:              ">>,
 3621:            [],
 3622:            %% No behaviour-info(), but callback.
 3623:            {errors,[{{3,16},erl_lint,{undefined_callback,{lint_test,b1,1}}}],[]}},
 3624:           {otp_11861_5,
 3625:            <<"
 3626:               -optional_callbacks([{b1,1}]). % non-existing
 3627:              ">>,
 3628:            [],
 3629:            %% No behaviour-info() and no callback: warning anyway
 3630:            {errors,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{undefined_callback,{lint_test,b1,1}}}],[]}},
 3631:           {otp_11861_6,
 3632:            <<"
 3633:               -optional_callbacks([b1/1]). % non-existing
 3634:               behaviour_info(callbacks) -> [{b1,1}].
 3635:              ">>,
 3636:            [],
 3637:            %% behaviour-info() and no callback: warning anyway
 3638:            {errors,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{undefined_callback,{lint_test,b1,1}}}],[]}},
 3639:           {otp_11861_7,
 3640:            <<"
 3641:               -optional_callbacks([b1/1]). % non-existing
 3642:               -callback b(_) -> atom().
 3643:               behaviour_info(callbacks) -> [{b1,1}].
 3644:              ">>,
 3645:            [],
 3646:            %% behaviour-info() callback: warning
 3647:            {errors,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{undefined_callback,{lint_test,b1,1}}},
 3648:                     {{3,16},erl_lint,{behaviour_info,{lint_test,b,1}}}],
 3649:             []}},
 3650:           {otp_11861_8,
 3651:            <<"
 3652:               -callback b(_) -> atom().
 3653:               -optional_callbacks([b/1, {b, 1}]).
 3654:              ">>,
 3655:            [],
 3656:            {errors,[{{3,16},erl_lint,{redefine_optional_callback,{b,1}}}],[]}},
 3657:           {otp_11861_9,
 3658:            <<"
 3659:               -behaviour(gen_server).
 3660:               -export([handle_call/3,handle_cast/2,handle_info/2,
 3661:                        code_change/3, init/1, terminate/2]).
 3662:               handle_call(_, _, _) -> ok.
 3663:               handle_cast(_, _) -> ok.
 3664:               handle_info(_, _) -> ok.
 3665:               code_change(_, _, _) -> ok.
 3666:               init(_) -> ok.
 3667:               terminate(_, _) -> ok.
 3668:              ">>,
 3669:            [],
 3670:            []},
 3671:           {otp_11861_9,
 3672:            <<"
 3673:               -behaviour(gen_server).
 3674:               -export([handle_call/3,handle_cast/2,handle_info/2,
 3675:                        code_change/3, init/1, terminate/2, format_status/2]).
 3676:               handle_call(_, _, _) -> ok.
 3677:               handle_cast(_, _) -> ok.
 3678:               handle_info(_, _) -> ok.
 3679:               code_change(_, _, _) -> ok.
 3680:               init(_) -> ok.
 3681:               terminate(_, _) -> ok.
 3682:               format_status(_, _) -> ok. % optional callback
 3683:              ">>,
 3684:            [],
 3685:            %% Nothing...
 3686:            []},
 3687:           {otp_11861_10,
 3688:            <<"
 3689:               -optional_callbacks([{b1,1,bad}]). % badly formed and ignored
 3690:               behaviour_info(callbacks) -> [{b1,1}].
 3691:              ">>,
 3692:            [],
 3693:            []},
 3694:           {otp_11861_11,
 3695:            <<"
 3696:               -behaviour(bad_behaviour1).
 3697:              ">>,
 3698:            [],
 3699:            {warnings,[{{2,16},erl_lint,
 3700:                        {ill_defined_behaviour_callbacks,bad_behaviour1}}]}},
 3701:           {otp_11861_12,
 3702:            <<"
 3703:               -behaviour(non_existing_behaviour).
 3704:              ">>,
 3705:            [],
 3706:            {warnings,[{{2,16},erl_lint,
 3707:                        {undefined_behaviour,non_existing_behaviour}}]}},
 3708:           {otp_11861_13,
 3709:            <<"
 3710:               -behaviour(bad_behaviour_none).
 3711:              ">>,
 3712:            [],
 3713:            {warnings,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{undefined_behaviour,bad_behaviour_none}}]}},
 3714:           {otp_11861_14,
 3715:            <<"
 3716:               -callback b(_) -> atom().
 3717:              ">>,
 3718:            [],
 3719:            []},
 3720:           {otp_11861_15,
 3721:            <<"
 3722:               -optional_callbacks([{b1,1,bad}]). % badly formed
 3723:               -callback b(_) -> atom().
 3724:              ">>,
 3725:            [],
 3726:            []},
 3727:           {otp_11861_16,
 3728:            <<"
 3729:               -callback b(_) -> atom().
 3730:               -callback b(_) -> atom().
 3731:              ">>,
 3732:            [],
 3733:            {errors,[{{3,16},erl_lint,{redefine_callback,{b,1}}}],[]}},
 3734:           {otp_11861_17,
 3735:            <<"
 3736:               -behaviour(bad_behaviour2).
 3737:              ">>,
 3738:            [],
 3739:            {warnings,[{{2,16},erl_lint,{undefined_behaviour_callbacks,
 3740:                                    bad_behaviour2}}]}},
 3741:           {otp_11861_18,
 3742:            <<"
 3743:               -export([f1/1]).
 3744:               -behaviour(callback3).
 3745:               f1(_) -> ok.
 3746:              ">>,
 3747:            [],
 3748:            []}
 3749: 	 ],

 3805: 
 3806: %% Check that format warnings are generated.
 3807: format_warn(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3808:     L1 = 16,
 3809:     L2 = 5,
 3810:     format_level(1, L1, Config),
 3811:     format_level(2, L1+L2, Config),
 3812:     format_level(3, L1+L2, Config),             %there is no level 3
 3813:     ok.
 3814: 
 3815: format_level(Level, Count, Config) ->
 3816:     W = get_compilation_result(Config, "format",
 3817:                                      [{warn_format, Level}]),
 3818:     %% Pick out the 'format' warnings.
 3819:     FW = lists:filter(fun({_Line, erl_lint, {format_error, _}}) -> true;
 3820:                                (_) -> false
 3821:                             end,
 3822:                             W),
 3823:     case length(FW) of
 3824:               Count ->
 3825:                   ok;
 3826:               Other ->
 3827:                   io:format("Expected ~w warning(s); got ~w", [Count,Other]),
 3828:                   fail()
 3829:           end,
 3830:     ok.
 3831:

 3833:

 3835: on_load_successful(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 3836:     Ts = [{on_load_1,
 3837: 	   %% Exported on_load function.

 3849:              ">>,
 3850: 	   {[]},				%Tuple indicates no 'export_all'.
 3851: 	   []},

 3858:              bar(N) -> 2*N.

 3861: 	   []}

 4237: %% OTP-11851: More atoms can be used as type names + bug fixes.
 4238: otp_11851(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4239:     Ts = [
 4240: 	{otp_11851_1,
 4241: 	 <<"-export([t/0]).
 4242:             -type range(A, B) :: A | B.
 4243: 
 4244:             -type union(A) :: A.
 4245: 
 4246:             -type product() :: integer().
 4247: 
 4248:             -type tuple(A) :: A.
 4249: 
 4250:             -type map(A) :: A.
 4251: 
 4252:             -type record() :: a | b.
 4253: 
 4254:             -type integer(A) :: A.
 4255: 
 4256:             -type atom(A) :: A.
 4257: 
 4258:             -type binary(A, B) :: A | B.
 4259: 
 4260:             -type 'fun'() :: integer().
 4261: 
 4262:             -type 'fun'(X) :: X.
 4263: 
 4264:             -type 'fun'(X, Y) :: X | Y.
 4265: 
 4266:             -type all() :: range(atom(), integer()) | union(pid()) | product()
 4267:                          | tuple(reference()) | map(function()) | record()
 4268:                          | integer(atom()) | atom(integer())
 4269:                          | binary(pid(), tuple()) | 'fun'(port())
 4270:                          | 'fun'() | 'fun'(<<>>, 'none').
 4271: 
 4272:             -spec t() -> all().
 4273: 
 4274:             t() ->
 4275:                 a.
 4276: 	">>,
 4277: 	[],
 4278: 	[]},
 4279: 	{otp_11851_2,
 4280: 	 <<"-export([a/1, b/1, t/0]).
 4281: 
 4282:             -callback b(_) -> integer().
 4283: 
 4284:             -callback ?MODULE:a(_) -> integer().
 4285: 
 4286:             a(_) -> 3.
 4287: 
 4288:             b(_) -> a.
 4289: 
 4290:             t()-> a.
 4291: 	">>,
 4292: 	[],
 4293: 	{errors,[{{5,14},erl_lint,{bad_callback,{lint_test,a,1}}}],[]}},
 4294: 	{otp_11851_3,
 4295: 	 <<"-export([a/1]).
 4296: 
 4297:             -spec a(_A) -> boolean() when
 4298:                   _ :: atom(),
 4299:                   _A :: integer().
 4300: 
 4301:             a(_) -> true.
 4302: 	">>,
 4303: 	[],
 4304: 	{errors,[{{4,19},erl_parse,"bad type variable"}],[]}},
 4305: 	{otp_11851_4,
 4306: 	 <<"
 4307:             -spec a(_) -> ok.
 4308:             -spec a(_) -> ok.
 4309: 
 4310:             -spec ?MODULE:a(_) -> ok.
 4311:             -spec ?MODULE:a(_) -> ok.
 4312: 	">>,
 4313: 	[],
 4314:          {errors,[{{3,14},erl_lint,{redefine_spec,{a,1}}},
 4315:                   {{5,14},erl_lint,{redefine_spec,{lint_test,a,1}}},
 4316:                   {{6,14},erl_lint,{redefine_spec,{lint_test,a,1}}},
 4317:                   {{6,14},erl_lint,{spec_fun_undefined,{a,1}}}],
 4318:           []}}
 4319:           ],
 4320:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 4321:     ok.
 4322: 
 4323: %% OTP-11879: The -spec f/a :: (As) -> B; syntax removed,
 4324: %% and is_subtype/2 deprecated.
 4325: otp_11879(_Config) ->
 4326:     Fs = [{attribute,0,file,{"file.erl",0}},
 4327:           {attribute,0,module,m},
 4328:           {attribute,1,spec,
 4329:            {{f,1},
 4330:             [{type,2,'fun',[{type,3,product,[{var,4,'V1'},
 4331:                                              {var,5,'V1'}]},
 4332:                             {type,6,integer,[]}]}]}},
 4333:           {attribute,20,callback,
 4334:            {{cb,21},
 4335:             [{type,22,'fun',[{type,23,product,[{var,24,'V1'},
 4336:                                                {var,25,'V1'}]},
 4337:                              {type,6,integer,[]}]}]}}],
 4338:     {error,[{"file.erl",
 4339:              [{1,erl_lint,{spec_fun_undefined,{f,1}}},
 4340:               {2,erl_lint,spec_wrong_arity},
 4341:               {22,erl_lint,callback_wrong_arity}]}],
 4342:      []} = compile_forms(Fs, [return,report]),
 4343:     ok.
 4344: 
 4345: compile_forms(Terms, Opts) ->
 4346:     Forms = [erl_parse:anno_from_term(Term) || Term <- Terms],
 4347:     compile:forms(Forms, Opts).
 4348: 
 4349: %% OTP-13230: -deprecated without -module.
 4350: otp_13230(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4351:     Abstr = <<"-deprecated([{frutt,0,next_version}]).">>,
 4352:     {errors,[{{1,2},erl_lint,undefined_module},
 4353:              {{1,2},erl_lint,{bad_deprecated,{frutt,0}}}],
 4354:      []} = run_test2(Config, Abstr, []),
 4355:     ok.
 4356:

 4360:               b() -> #r{a=foo,b=42,a=bar}.
 4361:               u(R) -> R#r{a=1,b=2,a=2}.
 4362:              ">>,
 4363:            [],
 4364:            {errors,[{{2,36},erl_lint,{redefine_field,r,a}},
 4365: 		    {{3,35},erl_lint,{redefine_field,r,a}}],[]}}],
 4366:     run(Config, Ts).

 4417: %% OTP-14285: We currently don't support non-latin1 module names.
 4418: 
 4419: non_latin1_module(Config) ->
 4420:     Expected = [non_latin1_module_unsupported],
 4421:     Expected = check_module_name('юникод'),
 4422:     Expected = check_module_name(list_to_atom([256,$a,$b,$c])),
 4423:     Expected = check_module_name(list_to_atom([$a,$b,256,$c])),
 4424: 
 4425:     "module names with non-latin1 characters are not supported" =
 4426:         format_error(non_latin1_module_unsupported),
 4427:     BadCallback =
 4428:         {bad_callback,{'кирилли́ческий атом','кирилли́ческий атом',0}},
 4429:     BadModule =
 4430:         {bad_module,{'кирилли́ческий атом','кирилли́ческий атом',0}},
 4431:     "explicit module not allowed for callback "
 4432:     "'кирилли́ческий атом':'кирилли́ческий атом'/0" =
 4433:         format_error(BadCallback),
 4434:     UndefBehav = {undefined_behaviour,'кирилли́ческий атом'},
 4435:     "behaviour 'кирилли́ческий атом' undefined" =
 4436:         format_error(UndefBehav),
 4437:     Ts = [{non_latin1_module,
 4438:            <<"
 4439:             %% Report uses of module names with non-Latin-1 characters.
 4440: 
 4441:             -import('кирилли́ческий атом', []).
 4442:             -behaviour('кирилли́ческий атом').
 4443:             -behavior('кирилли́ческий атом').
 4444: 
 4445:             -callback 'кирилли́ческий атом':'кирилли́ческий атом'() -> a.
 4446: 
 4447:             %% erl_lint:gexpr/3 is not extended to check module name here:
 4448:             t1() when 'кирилли́ческий атом':'кирилли́ческий атом'(1) ->
 4449:                 b.
 4450: 
 4451:             t2() ->
 4452:                 'кирилли́ческий атом':'кирилли́ческий атом'().
 4453: 
 4454:             -spec 'кирилли́ческий атом':'кирилли́ческий атом'() -> atom().
 4455: 
 4456:             -spec 'кирилли́ческий атом'(integer()) ->
 4457:               'кирилли́ческий атом':'кирилли́ческий атом'().
 4458: 
 4459:             'кирилли́ческий атом'(1) ->
 4460:                 'кирилли́ческий атом':f(),
 4461:                 F = f,
 4462:                 'кирилли́ческий атом':F()."/utf8>>,
 4463:            [],
 4464:            {error,
 4465:             [{{4,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4466:              {{5,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4467:              {{6,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4468:              {{8,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4469:              {{8,14},erl_lint,BadCallback},
 4470:              {{11,23},erl_lint,illegal_guard_expr},
 4471:              {{15,17},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4472:              {{17,14},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4473:              {{17,14},erl_lint,BadModule},
 4474:              {{20,15},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4475:              {{23,17},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported},
 4476:              {{25,17},erl_lint,non_latin1_module_unsupported}],
 4477:             [{{5,14},erl_lint,UndefBehav},
 4478:              {{6,14},erl_lint,UndefBehav}]}}],
 4479:     run(Config, Ts),
 4480:     ok.
 4481: 
 4482: illegal_module_name(_Config) ->
 4483:     [empty_module_name] = check_module_name(''),
 4484: 
 4485:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('\x00'),
 4486:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('abc\x1F'),
 4487:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('\x7F'),
 4488:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('abc\x80'),
 4489:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('abc\x80xyz'),
 4490:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name] = check_module_name('\x9Fxyz'),
 4491: 
 4492:     [ctrl_chars_in_module_name,
 4493:      non_latin1_module_unsupported] = check_module_name('атом\x00'),
 4494: 
 4495:     [blank_module_name] = check_module_name(' '),
 4496:     [blank_module_name] = check_module_name('\xA0'),
 4497:     [blank_module_name] = check_module_name('\xAD'),
 4498:     [blank_module_name] = check_module_name('  \xA0\xAD '),
 4499: 
 4500:     %% White space and soft hyphens are OK if there are visible
 4501:     %% characters in the name.
 4502:     ok = check_module_name(' abc '),
 4503:     ok = check_module_name('abc '),
 4504:     ok = check_module_name(' abc '),
 4505:     ok = check_module_name(' abc xyz '),
 4506:     ok = check_module_name(' abc\xADxyz '),
 4507: 
 4508:     ok.
 4509: 
 4510: check_module_name(Mod) ->
 4511:     File = atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".erl",
 4512:     L1 = erl_anno:new(1),
 4513:     Forms = [{attribute,L1,file,{File,1}},
 4514:              {attribute,L1,module,Mod},
 4515:              {eof,2}],
 4516:     _ = compile:forms(Forms),
 4517:     case compile:forms(Forms, [return]) of
 4518:         {error,Errors,[]} ->
 4519:             [{_ModName,L}] = Errors,
 4520:             lists:sort([Reason || {1,erl_lint,Reason} <- L]);
 4521:         {ok,Mod,Code,Ws} when is_binary(Code), is_list(Ws)  ->
 4522:             ok
 4523:     end.
 4524: 
 4525: otp_14378(Config) ->
 4526:     Ts = [
 4527:           {otp_14378_1,
 4528:            <<"-export([t/0]).
 4529:               -compile({nowarn_deprecated_function,{erlang,now,1}}).
 4530:               t() ->
 4531:                  erlang:now().">>,
 4532:            [],
 4533:            {warnings,[{{4,18},erl_lint,
 4534:                        {deprecated,{erlang,now,0},
 4535:                         "see the \"Time and Time Correction in Erlang\" "
 4536:                         "chapter of the ERTS User's Guide for more "
 4537:                         "information"}}]}}],
 4538:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 4539:     ok.

 4589: stacktrace_syntax(Config) ->
 4590:     Ts = [{guard,
 4591:            <<"t1() ->
 4592:                   try error(foo)
 4593:                   catch _:_:Stk when is_number(Stk) -> ok
 4594:                   end.

 4598:           {bound,
 4599:            <<"t1() ->
 4600:                   Stk = [],
 4601:                   try error(foo)
 4602:                   catch _:_:Stk -> ok
 4603:                   end.
 4604:            ">>,
 4605:            [],
 4606:            {errors,[{{4,29},erl_lint,{stacktrace_bound,'Stk'}}],[]}},
 4607:           {bound_in_pattern,
 4608:            <<"t1() ->
 4609:                   try error(foo)
 4610:                   catch _:{x,T}:T -> ok
 4611:                   end.
 4612:            ">>,
 4613:            [],
 4614:            {errors,[{{3,33},erl_lint,{stacktrace_bound,'T'}}],[]}},
 4615:           {guard_and_bound,
 4616:            <<"t1() ->
 4617:                   Stk = [],
 4618:                   try error(foo)
 4619:                   catch _:_:Stk when is_integer(Stk) -> ok
 4620:                   end.
 4621:            ">>,
 4622:            [],
 4623:            {errors,[{{4,29},erl_lint,{stacktrace_bound,'Stk'}},
 4624:                     {{4,49},erl_lint,{stacktrace_guard,'Stk'}}],[]}}
 4625:          ],

 4627:     run(Config, Ts),
 4628:     ok.

 4706: removed(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4707:     Ts = [{removed,
 4708:           <<"-removed([{nonexistent,1,\"hi\"}]). %% okay since it doesn't exist
 4709:              -removed([frutt/0]).   %% okay since frutt/0 is not exported
 4710:              -removed([t/0]).       %% not okay since t/0 is exported
 4711:              -removed([{t,'_'}]).   %% not okay since t/0 is exported
 4712:              -removed([{'_','_'}]). %% not okay since t/0 is exported

 4714:              -removed('badly formed').

 4716:              frutt() -> ok.
 4717:              t() -> ok.
 4718:             ">>,

 4721:                    {{4,15},erl_lint,{bad_removed,{t,'_'}}},
 4722:                    {{5,15},erl_lint,{bad_removed,{'_','_'}}},
 4723:                    {{6,15},erl_lint,{invalid_removed,{{badly,formed},1}}},

 4730: otp_16516(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 4731:     one_multi_init(Config),
 4732:     several_multi_inits(Config).
 4733: 
 4734: one_multi_init(Config) ->
 4735:     "'_' initializes no omitted fields" =
 4736:         format_error(bad_multi_field_init),
 4737:     Ts = [{otp_16516_1,
 4738:            <<"-record(r, {f}).
 4739:               t(#r{f = 17, _ = V}) ->
 4740:                   V.
 4741:               u(#r{_ = V, f = 17}) ->
 4742:                   V.
 4743:               -record(r1, {f, g = 17}).
 4744:               g(#r1{f = 3, _ = 42}) ->
 4745:                 g.
 4746:              ">>,
 4747:            [],
 4748:            {errors,[{{2,28},erl_lint,bad_multi_field_init},
 4749:                     {{4,20},erl_lint,bad_multi_field_init}],[]}},
 4750:           {otp_16516_2,
 4751:            %% No error since "_ = '_'" is actually used as a catch-all
 4752:            %% initialization. V is unused (as compilation with the 'E'
 4753:            %% option shows), but no warning about V being unused is
 4754:            %% output.
 4755:            <<"-record(r, {f}).
 4756:               t(V) ->
 4757:                   #r{f = 3, _ = V}.
 4758:               u(V) ->
 4759:                   #r{_ = V, f = 3}.
 4760:              ">>,
 4761:            [],
 4762:            []},
 4763:           {otp_16516_3,
 4764:            %% No error in this case either. And no unused variable warning.
 4765:            <<"-record(r, {f}).
 4766:               t(V) when #r{f = 3, _ = V} =:= #r{f = 3} ->
 4767:                   a.
 4768:               u(V) when #r{_ = V, f = 3} =:= #r{f = 3} ->
 4769:                   a.
 4770:              ">>,
 4771:            [],
 4772:            []}],
 4773:     [] = run(Config, Ts).
 4774: 
 4775: several_multi_inits(Config) ->
 4776:     Ts = [{otp_16516_4,
 4777:            <<"-record(r, {f, g}).
 4778:               t(#r{f = 17, _ = V1,
 4779:                            _ = V2}) ->
 4780:                   {V1, V2}.
 4781:               u(#r{_ = V1, f = 17,
 4782:                    _ = V2}) ->
 4783:                   {V1, V2}.
 4784:               v(#r{_ = V1, f = 17}) ->
 4785:                   V1.
 4786:              ">>,
 4787:            [],
 4788:            {errors,[{{3,28},erl_lint,bad_multi_field_init},
 4789:                     {{4,20},erl_lint,{unbound_var,'V1'}},

 5301:            [],

 5308:                       {{2,4},erl_lint,match_float_zero}]}},
 5309:           {float_zero_3,
 5310:            <<"t(A) when A =:= 0.0 -> ok;\n" %% Should warn.
 5311:              "t(A) when A =:= {0.0} -> ok.\n" %% Should warn.
 5312:              "k(A) -> A =:= 0.0.\n" %% Should warn.
 5313:              "q(A) -> A =:= {0.0}.\n" %% Should warn.
 5314:              "z(A) when A =:= +0.0 -> ok;\n" %% Should not warn.
 5315:              "z(A) when A =:= {+0.0} -> ok.\n">>, %% Should not warn.
 5316:            [],
 5317:            {warnings,[{{1,37},erl_lint,match_float_zero},
 5318:                       {{2,18},erl_lint,match_float_zero},
 5319:                       {{3,15},erl_lint,match_float_zero},
 5320:                       {{4,16},erl_lint,match_float_zero}]}}
 5321:          ],
 5322:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 5323: 
 5324:     ok.
 5325: 
 5326: %% GH-7655. When the module definition was missing, spurious
 5327: %% diagnostics would be emitted for each spec.
 5328: undefined_module(Config) ->
 5329:     Code = <<"-spec foo() -> 'ok'.
 5330:               foo() -> ok.
 5331:              ">>,
 5332:     {errors,[{{1,2},erl_lint,undefined_module}],[]} = run_test2(Config, Code, []),
 5333: 
 5334:     ok.
 5335: 
 5336: update_literal(Config) ->
 5337:     Ts = [{update_record_literal,
 5338:            <<"-record(a, {b}).
 5339:              t() -> #a{}#a{}#a{b=aoeu}.
 5340:              k() -> A = #a{}, A#a{}#a{b=aoeu}.">>,
 5341:            [],
 5342:            {warnings,[{{2,25},erl_lint,update_literal},
 5343:                       {{2,29},erl_lint,update_literal}]}},
 5344:           {update_map_literal_assoc,
 5345:            <<"t() -> #{}#{}#{b=>aoeu}.
 5346:               k() -> A = #{}, A#{}#{b=>aoeu}.">>,
 5347:            [],
 5348:            {warnings,[{{1,31},erl_lint,update_literal},
 5349:                       {{1,34},erl_lint,update_literal}]}},
 5350:           {update_map_literal_exact,
 5351:            <<"t() -> #{}#{}#{b:=aoeu}.
 5352:               k() -> A = #{}, A#{}#{b:=aoeu}.">>,
 5353:            [],
 5354:            {warnings,[{{1,31},erl_lint,update_literal},
 5355:                       {{1,34},erl_lint,update_literal}]}}
 5356:          ],
 5357:     [] = run(Config, Ts),
 5358: 
 5359:     ok.
 5360: 
 5361: %%%
 5362: %%% Common utilities.
 5363: %%%
 5364: 
 5365: format_error(E) ->
 5366:     lists:flatten(erl_lint:format_error(E)).
 5367: 
 5368: run(Config, Tests) ->
 5369:     F = fun({N,P,Ws,E}, BadL) ->
 5370:                 io:format("### ~s\n", [N]),
 5371:                 case catch run_test(Config, P, Ws) of
 5372:                     E -> 
 5373:                         BadL;
 5374:                     Bad -> 
 5375:                         io:format("~nTest ~p failed. Expected~n  ~p~n"
 5376:                                   "but got~n  ~p~n", [N, E, Bad]),
 5377: 			fail()
 5378:                 end
 5379:         end,
 5380:     lists:foldl(F, [], Tests).
 5381: 
 5382: %% Compiles a test file and returns the list of warnings/errors.
 5383: 
 5384: get_compilation_result(Conf, Filename, Warnings) ->
 5385:     DataDir = ?datadir,
 5386:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Filename),
 5387:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(File++".erl"),
 5388:     FileS = binary_to_list(Bin),
 5389:     {match,[{Start,Length}|_]} = re:run(FileS, "-module.*\\n"),
 5390:     Test = lists:nthtail(Start+Length, FileS),
 5391:     case run_test(Conf, Test, Warnings) of
 5392:         {warnings, Ws} -> Ws;
 5393:         {errors,Es,Ws} -> {Es,Ws};
 5394:         [] -> []
 5395:     end.
 5396: 
 5397: %% Compiles a test module and returns the list of errors and warnings.
 5398: 
 5399: run_test(Conf, Test0, Warnings0) ->
 5400:     Test = list_to_binary(["-module(lint_test). ", Test0]),
 5401:     run_test2(Conf, Test, Warnings0).
 5402: 
 5403: run_test2(Conf, Test, Warnings0) ->
 5404:     Filename = "lint_test.erl",
 5405:     DataDir = ?privdir,
 5406:     File = filename:join(DataDir, Filename),
 5407:     Opts = case Warnings0 of
 5408:                {Warnings} ->		%Hairy trick to not add export_all.
 5409:                    [return|Warnings];
 5410:                Warnings ->
 5411:                    [export_all,return|Warnings]
 5412:            end,
 5413:     ok = file:write_file(File, Test),
 5414: 
 5415:     %% We will use the 'binary' option so that the compiler will not
 5416:     %% compare the module name to the output file name. Also, there
 5417:     %% is no reason to produce an output file since we are only
 5418:     %% interested in the errors and warnings.
 5419: 
 5420:     %% Print warnings, call erl_lint:format_error/1. (But note that
 5421:     %% the compiler will ignore failing calls to erl_lint:format_error/1.)
 5422:     compile:file(File, [binary,report|Opts]),
 5423: 
 5424:     case compile:file(File, [binary|Opts]) of
 5425:         {ok, _M, Code, Ws} when is_binary(Code) ->
 5426:             warnings(File, Ws, Test);
 5427:         {error, [{File,Es}], []} ->
 5428:             print_diagnostics(Es, Test),
 5429: 	    {errors, call_format_error(Es), []};
 5430:         {error, [{File,Es}], [{File,Ws}]} ->
 5431:             print_diagnostics(Es, Test),
 5432:             print_diagnostics(Ws, Test),
 5433: 	    {error, call_format_error(Es), call_format_error(Ws)};
 5434:         {error, [{File,Es1},{File,Es2}], []} ->
 5435:             print_diagnostics(Es1, Test),
 5436:             print_diagnostics(Es2, Test),
 5437: 	    {errors2, Es1, Es2}
 5438:     end.
 5439: 
 5440: warnings(File, Ws, Source) ->
 5441:     case lists:append([W || {F, W} <- Ws, F =:= File]) of
 5442:         [] ->
 5443: 	    [];
 5444:         L ->
 5445:             print_diagnostics(L, Source),
 5446: 	    {warnings, call_format_error(L)}
 5447:     end.
 5448: 
 5449: call_format_error(L) ->
 5450:     %% Smoke test of format_error/1 to make sure that no crashes
 5451:     %% slip through.
 5452:     _ = [Mod:format_error(Term) || {_,Mod,Term} <- L],
 5453:     L.
 5454: 
 5455: print_diagnostics(Warnings, Source) ->
 5456:     case binary:match(Source, <<"-file(">>) of
 5457:         nomatch ->
 5458:             Lines = binary:split(Source, <<"\n">>, [global]),
 5459:             Cs = [print_diagnostic(W, Lines) || W <- Warnings],
 5460:             io:put_chars(Cs);
 5461:         _ ->
 5462:             %% There are probably fake line numbers greater than
 5463:             %% the number of actual lines.
 5464:             ok
 5465:     end.
 5466: 
 5467: print_diagnostic({{LineNum,Column},Mod,Data}, Lines) ->
 5468:     Line0 = lists:nth(LineNum, Lines),
 5469:     <<Line1:(Column-1)/binary,_/binary>> = Line0,
 5470:     Spaces = re:replace(Line1, <<"[^\t]">>, <<" ">>, [global]),
 5471:     CaretLine = [Spaces,"^"],
 5472:     [io_lib:format("~p:~p: ~ts\n", [LineNum,Column,Mod:format_error(Data)]),
 5473:      Line0, "\n",
 5474:      CaretLine, "\n\n"];
 5475: print_diagnostic(_, _) ->
 5476:     [].
 5477: 
 5478: fail() ->
 5479:     ct:fail(failed).
